This is the first zine I ever made! Titled "Black People Don't Do That: Canon Events of Black Children," I created it as the final project for the first Feminist Studies course I took during the summer before my freshman year. The zine serves as a personal reflection on my experience growing up as a Black child, exploring the formative, often unspoken moments—what I call “canon events”—that shape identity, perception, and belonging.

Don't forget to click through the pages!
